name: Chula Vista
shortDescription: A vibrant waterfront city just south of San Diego, offering family attractions, parks, and a growing restaurant scene.
fullDescription: Chula Vista is the second-largest city in San Diego County, located on the bay just south of downtown San Diego. Known for its waterfront marinas, family-friendly attractions like Sesame Place and the Living Coast Discovery Center, as well as its outdoor parks and growing craft-beer and dining culture, Chula Vista blends suburban charm with coastal living.
heroImageAlt: Aerial view of Chula Vista city with bay in the background

neighborhoods.name: San Diego
neighborhoods.description: Major coastal city just north, with beaches, downtown, and regional attractions.
neighborhoods.imageAlt: San Diego skyline viewed from the bay

highlights.title: Chula Vista Harbor
highlights.description: Scenic waterfront with two marinas, dining, parks, and boating access to San Diego Bay.

highlights.title: Sesame Place San Diego
highlights.description: Sesame Street-themed amusement and water park, family-oriented with rides, shows, and a wave pool.

highlights.title: Living Coast Discovery Center
highlights.description: Interactive coastal wildlife attraction in Sweetwater Marsh ‚Äî ideal for families and environmental learning.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Coastal marsh with birds and boardwalk

highlights.title: Outdoor Parks & Trails
highlights.description: Natural areas like Kumeyaay Park and camping trails around Sweetwater Reservoir perfect for hiking and picnics.

faqs.question: What are the best neighborhoods in Chula Vista?
faqs.answer: Waterfront areas near the harbor offer coastal living, Eastlake and Otay Ranch offer newer suburban homes, and Bonita and National City are great for quiet, family-friendly living.

faqs.question: How is the real estate market in Chula Vista?
faqs.answer: Chula Vista offers relatively more affordable options compared to coastal San Diego, with median home prices around $700K, though waterfront and newer developments are higher.

faqs.question: What are things to do in Chula Vista?
faqs.answer: Enjoy the waterfront harbor, Sesame Place theme park, Living Coast aquarium, local parks, and regional dining and breweries.

faqs.question: How is commuting from Chula Vista?
faqs.answer: Chula Vista is connected via I-5 and 805 freeways, with Trolley Blue Line access to downtown San Diego. Commute times range from 20‚Äì40 minutes depending on traffic.
